PERSONA:
emily wilson, a 68-year-old retired woman living in the metropolitan area of allentown, pennsylvania, in the northeast united states. born and raised in the united states, emily identifies as a protestant and attends church services once a week. she is a devout born-again christian and values her faith deeply.

emily graduated from high school and did not pursue higher education, instead choosing to focus on raising her family. she has been married to her husband, john, for 45 years. they have two grown children and four grandchildren. john, a retired mechanic, and emily live in a modest, single-family home in a suburban neighborhood, which they own and have paid off the mortgage for.

emily worked part-time jobs throughout her life to support the family, including stints as a grocery store clerk and a librarian's assistant. she never pursued a full-time career, choosing instead to devote her time to her family. john's income as a mechanic was the primary source of their household income during their working years.

their combined retirement income places their household in the middle-income tier, with an annual income of $55,000. emily and john rely on a mix of social security, pension, and retirement savings to support their living expenses. they own their home, free of mortgage payments, and have managed their finances carefully over the years to maintain a comfortable standard of living.

emily is an avid user of the internet, accessing it several times a day to stay connected with family and friends, read news, and shop online. she is also committed to community service, volunteering at the local food bank and participating in charity events organized by her church.

as a conservative republican, emily's politics are shaped by her faith and personal values. she supports traditional marriage, is pro-life, and advocates for limited government intervention in personal freedoms. she and john have been consistent voters, always making sure to cast their ballots in local and national elections.

emily's primary economic concerns include maintaining the purchasing power of their retirement savings and ensuring the availability of affordable healthcare for seniors. she is also worried about the national debt and its potential impact on future generations.

in her free time, emily enjoys gardening, reading historical fiction, and spending time with her family. her values are centered around faith, family, and community, which influence her economic and political views.
